org.apache.cassandra.db

Class ClusteringBoundary

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.cassandra.db.AbstractClusteringPrefix
      • org.apache.cassandra.db.AbstractBufferClusteringPrefix
        • org.apache.cassandra.db.ClusteringBoundOrBoundary
          • org.apache.cassandra.db.ClusteringBoundary
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IMeasurableMemory, Clusterable, ClusteringPrefix

    public class ClusteringBoundary
extends ClusteringBoundOrBoundary
    The threshold between two different ranges, i.e. a shortcut for the combination of two ClusteringBounds -- one specifying the end of one of the ranges, and its (implicit) complement specifying the beginning of the other.

      • invert

        public ClusteringBoundary invert()
        Description copied from class: ClusteringBoundOrBoundary
        Returns the inverse of the current bound.

        This invert both start into end (and vice-versa) and inclusive into exclusive (and vice-versa).

        Specified by:
        invert in class ClusteringBoundOrBoundary
        Returns:
        the invert of this bound. For instance, if this bound is an exlusive start, this return an inclusive end with the same values.
